title: Drawing, 1755–60
medium: Brush and gray watercolor, pen and sepia ink on laid paper
markings: watermark: lily in circle; above: V
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Three-story building with what seems to be a loggia on the top. Some groups of figures. Trees at left and right. Above at right: a sketch for the profile of the outer sides of the loggia.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, 1755–60. Brush and gray watercolor, pen and sepia ink on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-489.
